intro: Olearia oliganthema, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy bush, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and inland areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage is aromatic and often used in traditional Māori medicine. Olearia oliganthema is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native insect populations.
